subject: Communication
title: Filter Bubbles and Echo Chambers
description: One-minute skill: Filter Bubbles and Echo Chambers.

hook.text: Two people Google the same topic and get completely different results.

buildup.text: Eli Pariser coined 'filter bubble': algorithms personalize content based on past behavior, narrowing your information.

discovery.text: Echo chambers go further: social groups where everyone shares the same views, reinforcing beliefs and demonizing.

twist.text: Research suggests filter bubbles may be less powerful than feared.

climax.text: The problem isn't just algorithmic. It's psychological: we self-sort into like-minded groups because disagreement is.

punchline.text: Algorithms build the bubble. We choose to stay inside it.
